channel.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: US Elections News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Those responsible for indiscriminate killings': Bangladesh to seek Interpol 'red notices' for fugitive Hasina loyalists
item.description: Bangladesh said Sunday it would request an Interpol "red notice" alert for fugitive leaders of the ousted regime of former prime minister Sheikh Hasina, who was toppled in a revolution in August. Red notices issued by the global police body alert law enforcement agencies worldwide about fugitives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Palestinian hospital official says 17 killed in Israeli strike on northern Gaza
item.description: An Israeli airstrike on a home sheltering displaced Palestinians in the Jabaliya refugee camp in the northern Gaza Strip resulted in at least 17 fatalities, including nine women, as confirmed by Dr. Fadel Naim, director of Al-Ahly Hospital. Rescue operations are ongoing, suggesting a potential increase in the death toll. The Israeli military has not issued a statement yet.

item.title: Watch: Old video of Pakistan girl claiming to be Trump's daughter goes viral
item.description: A 2018 video of a Pakistani woman claiming to be Donald Trump's daughter has resurfaced online after his 2024 election victory. Speaking in Urdu, the woman alleges mistreatment by Melania Trump and claims Trump doubted her mother's parenting. Though initially unnoticed, the video is now being widely shared on social media.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Did he drug me too?': Why Gisèle Pelicot's daughter fears she was also victimised
item.description: Gisèle Pelicot, 72, accused her ex-husband, Dominique, of drugging and orchestrating her rape by numerous men over a decade. Their daughter, Caroline Darian, discovered she might also be a victim after police found photos of her in evidence. Dominique admitted to drugging Gisèle and filming her assaults but denies abusing Darian.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Canada reports first human case of bird flu after teen tests positive
item.description: A teenager in British Columbia, Canada, has contracted the H5 strain of bird flu, marking the country's first confirmed human case. Health officials are investigating the source of the infection, suspecting animal-to-human transmission. While human cases are rare, the virus's ability to jump species raises concerns about its potential to mutate and spread among humans.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Iran man charged with plotting Trump assassination tasked with targeting Israeli tourists in Sri Lanka: US
item.description: The FBI has charged Iranian national and Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps operative Farhad Shakeri with plotting to assassinate former President Donald Trump and orchestrate attacks on Israeli tourists in Sri Lanka. Shakeri, currently a fugitive believed to be in Tehran, was allegedly tasked with organizing a mass shooting in October 2024.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: FEMA fires employee for instructing hurricane relief team 'to skip houses advertising Trump'
item.description: A FEMA staff member was fired for instructing disaster response teams in Florida to avoid homes displaying pro-Trump signs following Hurricane Milton. FEMA Administrator Deanne Criswell condemned the action, deeming it a violation of the agency's core values. An investigation is underway, and Florida Governor Ron DeSantis has launched a state-level inquiry into the incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Putin signs treaty with North Korea, strengthening military ties amid Ukraine conflict
item.description: Russia and North Korea have formalized a strategic partnership, including a mutual defense agreement. The treaty, ratified by Putin, follows reports of North Korean arms supplies to Russia and the deployment of North Korean troops to Ukraine. This development has raised concerns among Western nations, particularly as Ukrainian forces face mounting pressure from a renewed Russian offensive.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan man stages kidnapping after killing son; arrested
item.description: A man in Lahore, Pakistan, was arrested for allegedly murdering his seven-year-old son and staging a kidnapping. The child's body was found buried at their residence. In other incidents, a woman suffered severe burns after her husband allegedly threw acid on her, and a man killed his wife and seven children due to financial hardship.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Air pollution soars in Pakistan as Lahore battles smog; Multan's AQI remains over 1,900
item.description: Smog has choked Pakistan's Punjab province, pushing air pollution to hazardous levels. Lahore's Air Quality Index (AQI) reached 760, while Multan hit a shocking 1,914, prompting emergency measures. The smog has caused accidents due to low visibility and forced closures of businesses and public spaces. Authorities blame cross-border pollution from India for exacerbating the crisis.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nikki Haley, Mike Pompeo to not be part of Trump 2.0 cabinet
item.description: Former US President Donald Trump announced that neither Nikki Haley nor Mike Pompeo will be part of his upcoming administration. Trump expressed gratitude for their past service but indicated they wouldn't be invited to serve in his potential 2025 White House team. Haley had criticized Trump during the GOP primaries, while Pompeo faced backlash for perceived disloyalty.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Interim govt to stop Awami rally
Awami student wing chief says working to restore democracy
item.description: Forced into hiding after their organization was banned by Bangladesh's interim government, the president of the Chhatra League told TOI that they are using social media to regroup and plan their next moves to restore democracy in the country. He added that over a lakh students are being prevented from continuing their education.
item.dc:creator: Mohua Chatterjee

item.title: North Korean GPS manipulation disrupted dozens of planes and vessels, South Korea says
item.description: North Korea disrupted GPS signals near its western border for a second day, impacting flights and ships. This follows a pattern of escalating tensions, with North Korea engaging in electronic warfare and propaganda campaigns against South Korea, raising concerns about aviation safety and regional stability.

item.title: American tourist on vacation found dead in Hungary; suspect arrested
item.description: An American tourist, Mackenzie Michalski, was tragically found dead in Hungary after being reported missing. The suspect, an Irish citizen she met at a nightclub, confessed to killing her during an "intimate encounter" and attempting to conceal the crime.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China, Indonesia cos set to ink $10bn deals
5 siblings, some deaf, among dead in Israeli hits in Lebanon
Qatar cannot continue Gaza talks, warns Hamas over Doha office: Source
Famine looming in north Gaza: UN-backed report
item.description: Famine is looming in the northern Gaza Strip amid increased hostilities and a near-halt in food aid, a UN-backed assessment said Saturday. The alert from the Famine Review Committee warned of "an imminent and substantial likelihood of famine occurring, due to the rapidly deteriorating situation in the Gaza Strip."

item.title: Maersk ship denied docking at Spanish port over Israel arms
